Package adept.kbapi

This package consists of all classes and interfaces related to the Adept Knowledge Base v3.

See: Description

    Interface Description
    SPARQLService  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    KB
    The most important class for using the KB API is adept.kbapi.KB.
    KBBelief
    The class KBBelief represents a Belief relation within the KB.
    KBBelief.InsertionBuilder
    Class for inserting a KBBelief into the KB.
    KBDate
    Class for representing Dates in the KB.
    KBDate.InsertionBuilder
    Class for inserting KBDates into the KB.
    KBEntity
    The Class KBEntity represents an entity saved in the knowledge base.
    KBEntity.InsertionBuilder  
    KBEvent
    Class KBEvent represents Events that have been saved in the KB.
    KBEvent.InsertionBuilder
    The InsertionBuilder class for Events.
    KBGenericThing
    Class for representing KB things which are mainly represented by a class and a string reference, i.e, Crimes, Sentences, Weapons, etc.
    KBGenericThing.InsertionBuilder
    InsertionBuilder class for inserting a KBGenericThing
    KBMentalState  
    KBMentalState.InsertionBuilder<T extends KBMentalState>  
    KBNumber
    This class represents numbers in the KB.
    KBNumber.InsertionBuilder
    Class defines the InsertionBuilder for a KBNumber object.
    KBObjectBuilder  
    KBOntologyMap
    A simple mapping between one ontology and another.
    KBOntologyModel
    Contains information about the current ontology for use in validation.
    KBParameters
    Reads the KBParameters.xml configuration file, and sets all KB parameters at the outset.
    KBPredicateArgument
    Superclass for all KB types which can be the argument of any predicate.
    KBPredicateArgument.InsertionBuilder<BuilderType extends KBPredicateArgument.InsertionBuilder<BuilderType,PredicateArgumentType>,PredicateArgumentType extends KBPredicateArgument>
    Default InsertionBuilder class, which holds provenances that will be inserted when the object is inserted.
    KBPredicateArgument.InsertionBuilderWithConfidence<BuilderType extends KBPredicateArgument.InsertionBuilderWithConfidence<BuilderType,PredicateArgumentType>,PredicateArgumentType extends KBPredicateArgument>
    Extension to default InsertionBuilder for objects which include a confidence value.
    KBProvenance  
    KBProvenance.InsertionBuilder  
    KBRelation
    The Class KBRelation represents a fully loaded, immutable relation.
    KBRelation.AbstractInsertionBuilder<BuilderType extends KBRelation.AbstractInsertionBuilder<BuilderType,RelationType>,RelationType extends KBRelation>
    Class InsertionBuilder for assembling the data required to insert a new KBRelation object.
    KBRelation.InsertionBuilder  
    KBRelationArgument
    This class represents the link between a KBRelation and one of its arguments.
    KBRelationArgument.InsertionBuilder
    Class for creating a new KBRelationArgument.
    KBSentiment
    The Class KBSentiment represents a pointer to a Knowledge Base Entity uniquely identified by KB URI and source KB type.
    KBSentiment.InsertionBuilder
    Class for inserting a KBSentiment into the KB.
    KBTemporalSpan  
    KBTemporalSpan.InsertionBuilder  
    KBTextProvenance
    A textual provenance for a KB Object.
    KBTextProvenance.InsertionBuilder

    LRUCache<K,V>  
    RemoteSPARQLService

Package adept.kbapi Description

This package consists of all classes and interfaces related to the Adept Knowledge Base v3.

Any algorithm producing entity level annotations that is compliant with the Adept API can use the functionality provided here to populate the knowledge base, modify it and query it.

1. Using the API
================

The adept.kbapi.KB class encapsulates a connection to the KnowledgeBase. It must be passed a KBParameters object which can be loaded as a resource or manually configured. To insert KB objects, create InsertionBuilders from the static methods on their object types (ex. KBEntity.entityInsertionBuilder(...)) To query or delete KB objects, use the methods on the KB class.

2. Adept KB Ontology
====================

The Adept KB ontology is defined to be compatible with both the TAC Cold Start and Rich-ERE ontologies. For systems that use either of the two standard type systems, we have included functionality that automatically maps the types generated by them to appropriate Adept ontology types. To enable this functionality, create insertion builders using the appropriate instance of the KBOntologyMap class.
The Adept ontology files can be viewed at the location adept-kb/src/main/resources/ontology.
